title.narrative: WASH Assistance for Conflict Affected Women, Men, Boys and Girls in Aleppo City and Suburb.

description.narrative:
This proposed project aims to secure sustainable access to safe drinking water and improved personal hygiene conditions for conflict affected women, men, boys and girls in Aleppo city and its surroundings. Due to the intensified military actions in the last few months, the humanitarian situation in Aleppo is deteriorating dramatically. This project is targeting the most affected and vulnerable families affected by the conflict. The selected sites for water system supply are prioritized by the WASH Sector for OCHA 2nd Standard Allocation. Oxfam's targeted locations are: 1) Al Khafse which is the water source for four key water pumping stations in the governorate Ain Al Baida, Sulaiman Al Halabi, Bab Al Nayrab and Tishreen, where the first three have sustained major damages. 2) Dwereneh village near Aleppo is hosting IDPs mainly from Al.Hamadanieh 1070 buildings, Manbeg, and Al.Bab. Women, men, boys and girls are heavily relying on water trucking coming from Jebreen and recent assessment indicates that especially vulnerable IDP families are struggling to maintain key health and hygienic practices. . 3) East Aleppo (Haedareh , Bostan Albasha, Shaikh Khouder , Alsakhour, Salheen , Sheikh Saaed ) and West Aleppo (Hamadaneh, Alshabaa, Aljameleh , Allmohafaseh , Sulimmanieh , Vialt) where the water network condition has deteriorated partly due to conflict and LWE limited resource. Sanctions imposed on the country have hindered the ability of the local water establishment to provide the frequent needed operational maintenance since 2011. Skeleton pipes (primarily in district level and secondary on governorate level) of the network are very old in some parts and severely damaged due to conflict, all in dire condition and need for immediate repairs and maintenance. This project proposes the following interventions in the above targeted areas: 1- Rehabilitation of the sand filters and the settling basins in the first and second stations In Al.Khafseh Water Treatment Station 2- Operation and maintenance (OM) emergency support of water supply network in eastern and western Aleppo based on needs. 3- Public Health Promotion in Aleppo city Nayrab , Ashrafieh , Khaldeyeh, Al-Ihasan and Dwereneh village (based on access and need ).
Implementation of project activities is subject to improved security and access in targeted areas. Oxfam will coordinate with OCHA, SARC, WASH sector, including UNICEF, and AWE to facilitate movement of staff, contractors, equipment and materials to sensitive sites. In case project is awarded, Oxfam will engage with OCHA on progress, challenges and constraints. Given the critical situation in some project sites, Oxfam will discuss with OCHA if reprogramming is needed at any stage during project life cycle, in line with SHF 2nd Standard Allocation objectives and criteria.
